At Meridian Technologies, we’re problem solvers.  We’re an award-winning IT solutions company that solves our clients tough business problems, whether it’s through consulting, staffing or technology.   As a [technical recruiter, sr. technical recruiter], I am responsible for matching exactly the right IT professionals to exactly the right positions.  We serve a diverse array of companies whose staffing needs range from basic IT support to niche-specific experts, and the bigger the challenge in finding exactly the right talent solution, the more we like it.  Meridian’s roots in technology make us uniquely qualified to find and assess the technical skills of our candidates so that we are sending only the most qualified professionals to our clients.  And this is why our clients, many of which are in the Fortune 500, keep coming back to Meridian.

Wrote two conference capsules and 14 team capsules for the D3Football.com Kickoff '11 season preview. Conducted interviews with coaches and players. Wrote two conference capsules, 18 team capsules and a feature story for Kickoff 2012.
Wrote articles, conducted interviews with fighters, coaches, and referees, including a cover story about Chris Leben.
Created, produced and co-hosted the weekly HWS Sportshour on 105.7, WHWS-FM. Scheduled and prepped guests and set agenda for each show.

Wrote game notes, game recaps and other articles pertaining to athletics at the Colleges as well as helping with the maintenance of the athletics website and live stats updates during football games. Also updated the Twitter account for the Athletics website and performed some editing.
Conducted coach interviews, wrote season previews and conference tournament recaps, contributed to yearly preseason roundtable.

Donald is a unique brand of employee, always looking for ways to not only better his own personal standing within the company, but to help improve the company as a whole. He has a team-first attitude that is rarely seen among writers and editors, and is always willing to lend a hand to his fellow colleagues and head up projects that fall outside of his titled role within the company.He is a major factor in the continued growth and expansion of Sports Media 101. His performance as editor on Jets 101 has led the site to the top of our QA rankings on monthly basis.

Donald does tremendous work covering the New York Jets with Jets 101. I've had the privilege of being a colleague of Donald's within the Sports Media 101 network. He not only does a great job with his own site, but he also goes out of his way to interact with those of us operating other sites, leaving insightful commentary about our work. Donald went above and beyond this spring, spearheading the SM101 network's NFL Draft coverage. He oversaw the communications over the entire network of a mock draft and then did all the research and follow up on each pick. I'm not much of a Jets fan, but I'm a big fan of Donald Lappe.

May 14, 2012, Donald reported directly to Dan

It has been an honor to work with Dan, as he is a tireless worker and is always willing to help. As the COO of Sports Media 101 Dan does a ton of work behind the scenes, facilitating everything the editors and writers in the network are able to accomplish. I have proposed projects to Dan and each time he has been very receptive and open to my ideas. It's a credit to his leadership ability that he is willing to listen to new ideas and develop those ideas into a plan of action as long as it is beneficial to everyone involved.I have tried to emulate Dan's work ethic as I admire his ability to not only lead the ever-growing Sports Media 101 network, but still continue his duties as the editor of Giants 101. Despite his attention being divided between Giants 101 and Sports Media 101 as a whole, Giants 101 continues to provide the best coverage of the New York Giants you can find.I have the utmost confidence that SM101 will continue to grow under Dan's watch and I would not hesitate to recommend him to anyone. It has been an absolute pleasure to work with Dan and I am looking forward to what the future holds.
